meanings.definition: A bright red powder made from dried and ground peppers.
meanings.sent1: I sprinkled some paprika on my eggs for extra flavor.
meanings.sent2: The paprika added a nice touch of color to the dish.
meanings.sent3: The paprika danced in the air as I seasoned the soup.
meanings.sent4: Her cheeks turned as red as paprika when she heard the surprise.
meanings.sent5: The paprika, like a fiery sunset, transformed the bland stew into a masterpiece.

meanings.definition: A seasoning used in cooking to add flavor and color to dishes.
meanings.sent1: Mom always adds paprika to her famous chili recipe.
meanings.sent2: The paprika jar was almost empty from all the cooking.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat pawed at the paprika shaker on the counter.
meanings.sent4: His jokes added a sprinkle of paprika to the conversation.
meanings.sent5: The aroma of paprika filled the kitchen, making mouths water in anticipation.
